alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Gulf; Liberty (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued December 14 at 6:56PM EST until December 14 at 7:45PM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Gulf County in the Panhandle of Florida... Southwestern Liberty County in Big Bend of Florida... Western Franklin County in Big Bend of Florida... * Until 745 PM EST/645 PM CST/. * At 656 PM EST/556 PM CST/, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 8 miles west of Port St. Joe to 20 miles south of Mexico Beach to 39 miles southwest of Apalachicola, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Apalachicola, Port St. Joe, Mexico Beach, Wewahitchka, Orange, Honeyville, Chipola Cutoff, Eleven Mile, Odena, Cape San Blas, Indian Pass, Beverly, Milltown, Kern, Bay City, Willis Landing, Apalachicola Airport, Simmons Bayou, Hays Place and Dalkeith. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 AM EST/100 AM CST/ for Big Bend of and the Panhandle of Florida. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 AM EST/100 AM CST/ for Big Bend of and the Panhandle of Florida.
